intro: Euphrasia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Euphrasia papuana is valued in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
